npcSchema.description: Standard structure for Midnight Nation NPCs and templates.

fields.name: NPC or archetype name.
fields.role: Short label describing their function (e.g. 'Mob Enforcer', 'Field Agent').
fields.tier: Relative power level: minion, standard, elite, boss.
fields.faction: Organization or allegiance (Ashwood Foundation, Covenant of St. Michael, Black Chamber, Mob, Independent, Cult, etc.).
fields.background: Closest matching PC background (Soldier, Mechanic, Private Eye, Occultist, Brawler, Doctor, Performer, G-Man, Gangster, Scientist).
fields.class: Closest matching PC class (Brawler, Gunner, Hunter, Warlock, Witch, Empath, Telekine, Priest, Thief).
fields.bloodline: If applicable: Celestial:Angelic, Celestial:Demonic, Lycanthrope:Wolf, Vampire:Nightwalker, etc., or null for mundane.
fields.competencies: Array of competency IDs from competencies.json.
fields.talents: Array of talent objects: { talent, subTalent, rank }.
fields.boons: Array of boon names from the boons JSON if the NPC has special edges.

woundProfile.notes: How many wound steps they typically endure; minions often drop at first Severe or Torso/Head hit.

equipment.weapons: Array of weapon names matching your price/gear table.
equipment.gear: Miscellaneous items or tools they commonly carry.

fields.tactics: How they fight, behave, and use abilities.
fields.storyHooks: Short notes on how to use this NPC in the narrative.

archetypes.name: Mob Enforcer

woundProfile.notes: Treat as having a slightly longer torso/arm track; usually fights on through Moderate wounds.

equipment.armor: Leather jacket (counts as very light armor vs. melee)

archetypes.tactics: Leads with intimidation and brute force. Uses SMG at close to medium range, closes to melee if cornered or ordered to make an example.
archetypes.storyHooks: Collects debts, guards mob warehouses, escorts high-ranking gangsters, or acts as the 'example' when the crew sends a message.

archetypes.name: Street Tough (Mob Goons)

woundProfile.notes: Drop or flee on first Severe wound or any Torso/Head Moderate+.

archetypes.tactics: Fight in groups, try to surround and overwhelm. Break and run once someone goes down hard or guns come out.
archetypes.storyHooks: Used as early combat encounters, bar troublemakers, or muscle backing up bigger villains.

archetypes.name: Beat Cop

woundProfile.notes: Standard human wound tracks; likely to withdraw once seriously hurt.

equipment.armor: Police uniform, cap; no real ballistic protection.

archetypes.tactics: Issue verbal commands first, call for backup, fire only when threatened. Unprepared for serious supernatural events.
archetypes.storyHooks: Harass PCs snooping around, be a potential ally if convinced, or become tragic collateral in a supernatural incident.

archetypes.name: Ashwood Foundation Hunter

woundProfile.notes: Can take multiple wounds before backing off; trained not to panic at the first sign of blood.

archetypes.tactics: Plans ambushes, uses cover and elevation, focuses fire on the most dangerous unnatural target. Will withdraw to re-engage under better conditions rather than die pointlessly.
archetypes.storyHooks: Rival or uneasy ally to the PCs, shows up at the same hunts, may execute creatures the PCs want to spare or study.

archetypes.name: Covenant Inquisitor

woundProfile.notes: Treat Soul wounds differently; may resist possession or spiritual attacks more strongly than physical harm.

equipment.armor: Clerical clothing or coat, no serious armor.

archetypes.tactics: Attempts to classify threats before acting. Uses wards and prayers to protect allies and drive off lesser spirits; only resorts to lethal force when necessary.
archetypes.storyHooks: May judge the PCs as acceptable, heretical, or dangerous. Could be an ally in an exorcism or a doctrinal antagonist whose methods clash with the party’s.

archetypes.name: Black Chamber Operative

woundProfile.notes: Planned extraction routes; rarely fights to the death unless mission-critical.

equipment.armor: Concealed vest or reinforced coat (light armor).

archetypes.tactics: Prefers control, blackmail, and containment over open fights. Shoots to disable or eliminate only when secrecy is at risk.
archetypes.storyHooks: Sent to observe, recruit, or shut down the PCs. May be a recurring antagonist or manipulative patron.

archetypes.name: Cult Acolyte

woundProfile.notes: Fold quickly under focused fire; may fight to the death if fanatically loyal.

archetypes.tactics: Swarm PCs with numbers or serve as ritual assistants. Rarely act independently, usually directed by a cult leader.
archetypes.storyHooks: Initial sign of a larger cult, captured for interrogation, or encountered mid-ritual.

archetypes.name: Cult High Priest

woundProfile.notes: May redirect or mitigate some wounds via pacts or dark protection; likely surrounded by acolytes and wards.

archetypes.tactics: Avoids direct combat; uses hexes, summoned entities, and hostages. Tries to escape through secret routes or dimensional tricks if the ritual goes badly.
archetypes.storyHooks: Centerpiece villain for a cult-focused arc; may be trying to summon something, ascend, or bargain with Infernal powers the PCs oppose.

archetypes.name: Vampire Night Stalker

woundProfile.notes: Regeneration outside sunlight; can ignore Light wounds, downgrades some Moderate wounds to Light with feeding.

archetypes.tactics: Strikes from ambush at night, isolates targets, uses claws/teeth and supernatural strength. Avoids bright lights and will retreat if exposed to serious sunlight sources or holy wards.
archetypes.storyHooks: Recurring nemesis, mysterious serial killer, or reluctant ally against something worse.

archetypes.name: Street Informant

woundProfile.notes: Avoids violence; will flee at first sign of real danger.

archetypes.tactics: Avoids fights entirely. Uses crowds, alleys, and exits. Knows who to talk to and who to avoid.
archetypes.storyHooks: First link to deeper conspiracies, source of rumors, may play all sides if desperate.
